Articles.Content: When I first started using Mechjeb, When I was building a craft for launching from another moon or planet, In the VAB I could set in the delta v window the planet/moon I was launching from and the delta v displayed would reflect what my delta v would be if I was a t that planet/moon. It was very handy for helping me to design landers. That was from a previous install. I have since reinstalled the entire game with all my mods I like and Mechjeb doesn't seem to have that capability anymore? Maybe I had a older version of Mechjeb before? I've got the newest one right now. 2.1.1 Any input would be appreciated.
No, it's Kerbal Engineer that does that
Yep, KER for that. It's the only reason I keep KER installed. Though I suspect when cost becomes a factor it will be useful for that, too.

Thanks for the responses. But im sure the delta v values for other planets and moons were in the mechjeb delta v window. It just had left and right arrows to toggle through all the bodies. I just cant figure out how to make it work again. I might try KER. Really like mechjeb. I've played through career mode a few times without it, but once I discovered it.......

Don't start a mechjeb vs. anti-mechjeb argument. This argument has been done way too many times before and there's been nothing new added to either side. Any further argumentative postings past my warning will be subject to removal and/or further moderation by me or other members of the forum staff.
Valiant : this function is in the dev version of MJ. See my signature for the link.

Valiant : this function is in the dev version of MJ. See my signature for the link.

That's it! thanks!
